Vasectomy: Vasectomy is a surgical procedure for male sterilization and is not related to breast cancer treatment.
Mastectomy: Mastectomy is a surgical procedure for the removal of the breast and is a common treatment for breast cancer.
Lumpectomy: Lumpectomy is a surgical procedure for the removal of a breast tumor and a small amount of surrounding tissue. It is an alternative to mastectomy for some patients with early-stage breast cancer.
Arthroplasty: Arthroplasty is a surgical procedure for the reconstruction or replacement of a joint and is not related to breast cancer treatment.

overall: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) can lead to excessive and irrational fears and behaviors, such as obsessively sanitizing fruits and vegetables, which can lead to vitamin deficiencies.
Vitamin A: Vitamin A is important for vision, immune function, and skin health. It is found in many fruits and vegetables, but excessive sanitizing and rinsing can lead to a loss of this vitamin.
Vitamin K: Vitamin K is important for blood clotting and bone health. It is found in many leafy green vegetables, but excessive sanitizing and rinsing can lead to a loss of this vitamin.
Vitamin C: Vitamin C is important for immune function, skin health, and wound healing. It is found in many fruits and vegetables, but excessive sanitizing and rinsing can lead to a loss of this vitamin.
Vitamin E: Vitamin E is important for skin health and immune function. It is found in many nuts and seeds, but excessive sanitizing and rinsing can lead to a loss of this vitamin.
